official_title: A bill to make certain miscellaneous changes in laws relating to the civil service.
short_title: Civil Service Miscellaneous Amendments Act of 1984

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Civil Service Miscellaneous Amendments Act of 1983 - Permits a retired administrative law judge who is receiving a civil service annuity to be temporarily appointed as an administrative law judge. Designates the Chairman of the Federal Labor Relations Authority as the chief executive and administrative officer of the Authority. Makes an arbitral award of such Authority final and binding if no exception is filed within 30 days after the award is served on a party to arbitration. Requires that a Federal employee sign a service agreement before participating in the Executive Exchange Program of the President's Commission on Executive Exchange. Reauthorizes the availability of the Office of Personnel Management revolving fund for such program. Authorizes the Department of the Navy to continue operating a specified personnel demonstration project at the Naval Weapons Center, China Lake, California, and at the Naval Ocean Systems Center, San Diego, California, until September 30, 1990, without regard to the current restriction on the number of individuals that may be involved in such project.
